website_summaries.verdict: The shape of this toy allows you to play tug-of-war with your pup without getting your hands near his teeth.
pros: A good toy for large breeds
It is really big at 11-inches long and 6-inches wide
Can handle aggressive chewing and pulling
Heavy duty build, feels solid and is easy to hold and throw
The toy holds its figure-8 shape
cons: This toy tends to have a strong rubbery smell
Meant for interactive play, not as an all-day chew toy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Heavy Duty Toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90 lb pit bull with pretty severe anxiety and having something for him to chew on is essential for him to be calm around my other dogs. He also has a very bad habit of swallowing the pieces of his toys that he chews off so this toy has been a life saver. It took him 8 months to chew through the toy this much and I attribute most of that to him being extra anxious over our move. Now that I know know there are other, sturdier versions of this toy I'll definitely buy that but I'm still very happy with this product because it lasted longer than any other we've had.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa L.

customer_reviews.title: Big dog and little dog approved
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a while before reviewing this. I have a 70lb pitbull and a 14.5 lb Italian Greyhound/MinPin. They both love this thing! They are both pretty big on chewing things in half and there isn't a single mark in this thing after a few months. They tugowar with eachother and our pitbull will tugowar with us as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Possible carcinogenic for your dog.
customer_reviews.text: So first thing out of the box, all I noticed was the overpowering smell. I have washed it multiple times, soaked it in vinegar, soaked it in baking powder, and laid it out in the sun. It still stinks! The company claims they "use the same rubber recipe as their ring" yet I can't find what this rubber recipe is. And trying to contact the company gives me an error message. I'm questioning whether it actually is made in the USA. My advice, skip the headache you'll get from the smell, and go with some other chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Lasted, but uninteresting
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs are aggressive chewers so I bought this, the doughnut, and the stick. They much prefer this one, however it holds little interest for them. Initially bought these to be kennel-safe toys for when my younger dog was in her kennel while we were away, however...she didn't care for it much, if at all, in her kennel. They both don't chew it really...which is how it's still intact after months. They only really play with it if I initiate a tug or hide-n-seek game, otherwise, it's not interesting. 4 stars for design and durability(?).
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY Heavy Chewer Toy That Actually Holds Up
customer_reviews.text: We've tried just about every single purported "heavy chewer" toy for our 1 yo female pittie and all of them were eviscerated within minutes. With the exception of some Kong toys, this is the only toy that, no matter what Lily tries, looks like new. We play "tug tug" which is a game of Tug of War and she *really* pulls and yanks and there's hardly any marks at all. She really loves it. She chews on it and it bounces right back. Some people have complained about the smell and their dogs don't like it. Lily had NO problem with it and went right for it. After a month, it's an A+++ in our book.
customer_reviews.author: Aki

customer_reviews.title: Tough Tug Toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very durable for a very strong chewer. It is heavy! It probably weighs 3 pounds. The rubber is thick and no chew marks have been visible yet since our Labrador/Great Dane mix started playing with it and chewing on it. Our dog weighs 69 pounds and has a large mouth that can hold two toys at once. He loves tug-o-war so that's why we bought this toy. We wish this toy was longer though to allow more space between the dog's mouth/teeth and our fingers/hand. It needs three rings instead of just two for more length. The toy is easy to clean and should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LEHD

customer_reviews.title: One of our new pup’s favorites!
customer_reviews.text: We recently got a 9 month old Amstaff/French Bulldog mix who can chew through almost anything. He’s an aggressive chewer who can destroy even the heavy duty black Kong toys in a few hours. Almost a month in and there’s barely a dent in this thing! He loves playing tug of war or just shaking it around and chewing on it. He even uses it as a tool to play with other toys lol! Bear in mind that it’s pretty large and heavy so you might want something smaller for a little dog. I will definitely be buying more of this brand! I got a close up pic to show how much damage he’s managed in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST & ONLY toy that's lasted!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY toy that has lasted over an hour with my mega chewer pitbull Mickey. He absolutely loves it- chewed 4 hours straight the first night and not a crack or dent was left behind. We are going on week 2 of it being chewed daily for hours. If this toy makes it a month, Goughnuts will have a customer for life! The smell is very similar to new tennis shoes- really not bad at all, in fact- Mickey liked the smell! Overall, I was nervous spending almost $30 on a toy for a dog that goes through the black Kongs like candy, but this toy is the best money can buy for INTENSE chewers
customer_reviews.author: ladynettie

customer_reviews.title: Latex Allergy! BUT Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I admit, I didn't read the description well enough.... I usually pass on things containing Latex because I am allergic to it on contact. Yet, my family LOVES to play tug & Fetch with the 8 & the Australian Shepherd & Pit Bulldog pup! He chews on so much, this relieved that!! The only other warning is watch your *personal* lap space because it is a tad heavy to have dropped in your lap when the pup wants to play.. I often hear from hubby & the son, "OUCH!!! not the *personals!!!*" Daughter & I agree the Lady bits don't enjoy it anymore than the guys...
customer_reviews.author: Kiristie Flores

customer_reviews.title: A very rugged toy suitable for independent play from the most aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for your aggressive chewers. My gf has an aggressive chewer, Newton. He's had this a week tomorrow and he has decreased the rubber smell, but that's it. No wear and tear. It is a fantastic independent play toy. It's very thick and very heavy. The thickness is what prevents him from shearing off a portion. We've only played inside, but this is the type of toy a dog, 80 pounds, probably more, can chomp onto and you can spin around in circles and he'll come off the ground, until you're too dizzy to do it anymore. It's Newton's favorite toy. I'll get some video and pictures up.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Incredible toy for strong chewers.
customer_reviews.text: We have a couple of strong chewers, a English bulldog and a golden doodle. they both have destroyed countless so-called indestructible strong chewer chew toys but this toy is the only one thus far has stood up to the punishment they deal out. The labradoodle specifically has been chewing on this toy Non-Stop since we got it and it has yet to show even a tooth mark. We seem to be very strong toys that are very well made and they have a lifetime warranty to back up their claims. I highly recommend this to anyone who has a dog that destroys just about everything. Even the strongest Kong toy doesn't stand up compared to this.
customer_reviews.author: Jef

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommended as a resisten toy
customer_reviews.text: Ok.. It has been months after buying this and it is exactly as it was when I bought it. There is no missing piece not even a hole even when it is flexible and feel like rubber... My dog is a straight dog similar to border Collie but she is destructive as hell.. Usually toys last minutes and you can notice it is a challenge for her to finish it in a moment but this toy has endured hard biting. Also it is usually its favor thing to play because she can pull from one of the loops while you pull from the other...
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Ch

customer_reviews.title: Goughnuts is another good quality dog toy brand like Kong extreme.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only other rubber dog toy, that's about as durable as Kong extreme. My pitbull terrier has only been able to put a few scratches on it, but so far he hasn't really destroyed it. I'm surprised to finally see another dog toy as tough as Kong extreme. I received this toy on April 10, 2019 and it's almost been two months since he's had it. I think it's going to take a while before he destroys it.
customer_reviews.author: robert dorvil

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for large pitbulls that love to chew and pull.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this brand. I got the stick first and was so satisfied with the purchase that I decided to try the ring. I couldn't be happier. I cannot buy regular toys for my dog because they only last a few minutes. With this brand, he hasn't been able to do any damage to either toy (and we have had the stick for almost a year now). Well worth the money. Some reviews complain about the rubber smell, but I didn't find that to be an issue. It does smell like rubber but it isn't overpowering. The toys do have weight to them because of how heavy duty they are. My 75 pound pit loves them.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to play tug with; the smell might turn some other people away
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to enjoy this toy. She likes to play tug, so this type of shape works best for me. I detracted one star because of the smell, but my dog doesn't seem to mind. I've read others' complaints about the smell. It is there, maybe it's bad for the dog, maybe not. The item is made in California, one of the strictest states for that type of regulation. I'm not too worried about my pup; I love her with all my heart and want the best for her.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: My dogs didn’t like this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dogs (labradors) that normally love tug toys. They had no interest. I took it to work, where my colleague has 2 labs that are normally very destructive, active chewers. They quickly lost interest. It seems to be too heavy for my dogs and it has a bad smell. 4 out of 4 dogs say no thank you. I think really big dogs that are aggressive chewers and don’t mind the taste of rubber might like this toy.
customer_reviews.author: H2014

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: So, at first, I was super skeptical of the quality of this toy. I had recently purchased a different brand of "tough" dog toy, and it only lasted 45 minutes. But I went out on a limb and decided to give Goughnuts a try. I am truly blown away by this company! This Goughnuts tug o war toy has held up fabulously. With two large dogs playing both tug o war AND taking turns chewing on it for a couple of months, this toy looks brand new! I will DEFINITELY be purchasing more dog toys from this company in the future. Thank you, Goughnuts, for making a top notch product!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great for super chewers!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TOY. I have a super chewer dog that destroys every toy. The rubber material on this is heavy duty and he has yet to even put a tooth mark in it. It is a great tug-of-war toy and leaves no mess to clean up (unlike the braided ropes). I look forward to owning more toys from this brand. My only complaint is that it does have a strong rubber smell that stays on your hands. Highly recommend this toy for any dog that likes to play.
customer_reviews.author: Doby

customer_reviews.title: Best, most durable toy for our extreme chewer
customer_reviews.text: Our pup is a chewer. In fact, we find it fun to time how long the “indestructible” toys last (normally 7-15 minutes to give you an idea). This toy has lasted well over a month (maybe two now) without even a bite mark and we play with it every day. He tries to chew on it and we play tug, so there’s ample opportunity for destruction. Plus he carries it around as his prized possession and it’s adorable! As a reference we have a 50 lb mixed breed dog (likely with some pit in him) and his chompers have taken out some pretty hardy toys very quickly before. This is the only thing that lasts!
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: We fostered a large and energetic lab that destroyed every toy we gave him. Gave this toy a try and it never showed any wear! He would chew on this while we watched a movie and it still looked brand new. Other toys only lasted a minute with him chewing on it. My dad has the same toy for his lab and it has lasted for over a year and is still goin. This is a great investment for a heavy chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, seems well made, but SMELLS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my dog's best dog friend has one and she kept stealing it, so she clearly loved it! However, when I ordered our own, it smelled VERY strongly of rubber. It smells so strongly that my pup barely touches it, which is a shame because it would be much better for a game of tug than most of the things she tries to play with. Washing it with dish soap had little to no effect. As time passes the smell is fading, so hopefully in another month or so it will be her favorite toy...
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is TRULY indestructible. My dog destroys EVERY toy, even most Kong brand toys that are supposed to be incapable of destruction. She’s a beast! She has yet to even put a tooth mark in this toy. I honestly believe it will last forever. It is super super thick so probably not a great toy for smaller dogs but if you’ve got a large dog who can tear through anything... this is your toy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Durable and lasting Pittie & bulldog
customer_reviews.text: My Pitbull LOVES this! I heard about these toys from some animal rescue folks and Wow so happy I took their advice. Both my 70ish lb pitbull and 80lb old English bulldog love this. My pit grabs this from all ends to include the middle (which is hilarious). I’ve had this about a month now and no signs of destruction and they chew on these multiple times every day. Nylabones tend to break heavy chewers teeth while these save your dogs teeth and gives them the instinctual chewing satisfaction. Thank you goughnuts!
customer_reviews.author: roxysea

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 13 months ago. It has been outside every day since I purchased it. My dog is a Great Dane/Rottweiler. He is 140 pounds and stands at three feet tall. He is a constant chewer. He carries and chews it literally hours a day. My kids even tie it up to drag it behind their bikes so the dog will chase after them. This is the most used and durable toy the dog has.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: DOUBLE DOUGHNUT!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of this company's toys. Love them all. It's a bit on the heavy side, so it's kind of funny to see my 40LB boxer lab mix try to run with it. she loves it though. The doughnut max (black) is still her favorite. Hate to do this but minus a star for it not floating in the pool. their websites say that "all of our toys float". It slowly floats for about 10 minutes, then sinks to the bottom and stays there. I happened to buy this specifically as a dog pool toy. All my other goughnut toys float.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Donegan

customer_reviews.title: Really tough but...
customer_reviews.text: The dog toy is much larger than I thought it would be. It is quite thick and too big for my 55 pound hound dog to play with. It is so thick that you can easily pull it from her mouth so tug-of-war is no fun. My dog does not play with it at all. It is very sturdy so it would be great for a very large dog (100 lbs plus), but not for medium or smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Russell C.

customer_reviews.title: Tough toy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one is starting to get some nicks in it, but not too bad. These are one of the only truly indestructible toys I've gotten for my dog. She destroys everything 'indestructible'. Most will only replace the indestructible toy once so it's not worth the price in the end. These have definitely been the strongest toys we've found.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Best toy brand for tough chewers
customer_reviews.text: I can not stress enough my love for this company. This is the third toy I have purchased from them. The other two are still alive and kicking. I have a pit bull mix who shreds all toys including kong extreme. These are the ONLY toys she can not damage. I’m talking she can’t even leave teeth marks they are so tough. Best part is that she doesn’t get bored with them. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Great tug of war toy for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a week ago. Other tug of war toys have been destroyed or pieces chewed off within minutes. We tried the Kong tug of war toy. Too flexible and thin for our two lab destroyers. After a week, jake from State Farm, who does not wear khakis, is carrying this Goughnut around, chewing on it, hitting the other lab, dammit whiskey, in the head with it, and playing tug of war. Not even a dent in it! Terrific product. It gets all of the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Barracudacool

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I have a 18 month old male Pit Bull which destroys everything in under 24/48 hours. So after reading the reviews I threw down some "BIG BUCKS" for this 1 toy. I'm pleased to report that it has "EASILY" withstood his powerful jaws, some mean games of tug-of-war and hours of non-stop abuse. FINALLY I have found my go-to toy for my lovable boy! Best dog toy on Amazon hands-down!!
customer_reviews.author: Just Saying

customer_reviews.title: Jameson has met hi match
customer_reviews.text: I have had several dog throughout my life including a 175lbs Saint Bernard and a large Rottweiler, but no dog I have even seen has the destructive chewing abilities of my lab/shepherd Jameson. Some dogs are straight power chewers, but not Jameson. Jameson is methodical and tactical in destroying his toys. He typically uses his front teeth to make small holes/tears in toys and then he exploit their new weaknesses. Toys at PetCo with a 10/10 durability rating have lasted this dog less than a day. This toy has stood up to Jameson and he loves it. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: R.W

customer_reviews.title: She Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an aggressive chewer and has destroyed all the toys we bought her. Until Goughnuts! She has the donut and ball and after one year has been able to inflict minimal damage to them. Now we got her the TUG! She loves it. It is somewhat heavy and large, but that is all the better for her because she is a strong dog at 75 pounds. She plays with it and tosses it up and chases after it. She even "shakes" it up. I highly recommend any of the Goughnuts products if you have an aggressive chewer. This toy is not for a small dog for it would be to big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product
customer_reviews.text: bought for our American Pit Bull Terrier as EVERYTHING we had bought and tried she literally would shred in a matter of minutes, price seemed a little high for a dog toy but when you figure in what you'd waste on all the others....save yourself some money and buy this brand!!! We're going on 3 months now an she absolutely loves it, an so far to date has NOT been able to shred it or bite through it to expose the colored center they speak of. We had even tried the K--G brand dog toys....yeah spend the money and save in the long run
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Toy For Chewers
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while and it looks like my dogs have never touched it... They have, they love playing tug of war with it, but you'd never know it. Goughnuts are the toys I've been looking for! My puppy is a boxer/ husky mix and destroys every toy, even ones that are more expensive because they're made for chewers. Where all those fail these succeed, they're expensive but worth it. I've definitely saved money by not having to replace dozens of crappy stuffed toys. Also you can feel comfortable leaving your dogs unattended with these, no choking hazards etc. I can't say enough good things about them!
customer_reviews.author: Joel D.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable for our dog
customer_reviews.text: After spending what seems like a fortune on supposed durable dog toys we have been very pleased with the Goughnuts products including this one. We have bought many toys some only lasting minutes with our 50 lb mixed Amstaff-Lab heavy chewer. This one and the black doughnut have lasted over a year without any signs of damage. They are very well made and somewhat heavy so keep away from breakable objects if your dog shakes toys or "throws" them.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Fan

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable for Heavy Chewers
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect item for a large dog with lots of jaw power! Our pup seemed to destroy anything she was given within in minutes.....until NOW!!!! Totally worth the $ especially since there is a lifetime guarantee. Make sure to research the products before you buy since they make different sizes and weights depending on your dog. Ours is an olde english bulldog and this one is even sometimes a bit heavy for her to swing around - but she loves it! Definitely would recommend this and we received it super fast!
customer_reviews.author: STL MH

customer_reviews.title: No interest from my dog
customer_reviews.text: This toy is solid and will likely last a long time. Unfortunately, my Doberman has zero interest in it, so it won't matter. It's bigger than I expected and hard for her to grip. She likes to play tug of war with dogs and people, and I thought this expensive toy would get a lot of use . I was completely wrong and it turned out to be a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Cheap but Worth Ever Penny
customer_reviews.text: This toy is my dogs favorite. They play tug on it all day long and chew on it constantly. It has some light scratches from that but overall this has really held up well. My dog is a pitbull so she's a heavy, heavy chewer. She hasn't been able to break this apart and trust me, she tries. It's not cheap but I recommend this 100%.
customer_reviews.author: PacNW Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 year old pitt mix loves this toy. It has a few nicks, but she hasn't destroyed it yet. We play with her and she plays with our older fox terrier mix. Sometimes even our cat claims it by laying on top of the toy. It's heavy... and it bounces... so I would not recommend throwing it inside the house much. Seems studier than some of the Kong Toys we've bought.
customer_reviews.author: julieee

customer_reviews.title: Great for Heavy Chewers!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the strongest that Goughnuts has, but it's by far my pitbulls favorite toy. It's extremely durable and has lasted a LONG time, but it's still soft enough for my soft-mouthed dog to play with. It's lasted so long and been loved so much, we ended up getting another when we thought we had left the first at the kennel!
customer_reviews.author: Joni Hall

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd puppy LOVES to tug and fight with this
customer_reviews.text: Exactly how it's described! It's NOT too hard so even a teething puppy will find it comfortable to engage with you using this toy to play tug! It does not appear to be too hard which would cause damage to a puppy's teeth! I can see my puppy continuing with this toy for a long long time way into adulthood!
customer_reviews.author: leatherneck111

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a toy my lab can't destroy!
customer_reviews.text: We have an extremely aggressive chewer of a lab, and this is one of the few toys he can't destroy. He absolutely loves playing with it, and the figure 8 design is great because it allows us to play tug of war while keeping our hands away from his mouth when he misses :) He loves the way it bounces when thrown. Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.author: AMF

customer_reviews.title: Flunked the smell test.
customer_reviews.text: This toy didn't pass my dog's smell test, she won't have anything to do with it. I soaked it in water for a couple days, then water with bleach but the stink persists. It has been outside int the weather for weeks but it still reeks. My dog has a hard black rubber ball with a tapered hole through the center that she works on for hours after packing a fresh treat in the hole. The dog hasn't been able to demolish it like most other balls.
customer_reviews.author: QQQQ

customer_reviews.title: Actual Indestructible chew toy!!! Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review to test out durability with my 2 pit bulls who tear up EVERY SINGLE TOY IN MINUTES! Even ones rated “indestructible “ This is a MUST HAVE FOR PARENTS OF POWER CHEWERS!!! Not only is it still fully in tact, it looks new! They chew on this constantly and can’t do any damage!!! This is a hidden treasure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The dog this was purchased for loves it, and amazingly hasn't damaged it at all! And he's a big guy with a strong jaw! (90+ lb am staf puppy). The toy is easy to use, he plays with it on his own and with the humans - even my 9 year old can play with him with the toy, and bc of the figure 8 design he doesn't complain about the slobber :)
customer_reviews.author: asineth

customer_reviews.title: Pit bull approved! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pitties that have non stop chewed and tugged on this toy for the past three days and it is still 100% intact! My dogs typically get through any “tough” toy within seconds! My one pit bull, Bruce, is obsessed with the toy and determined to destroy it but I think he’s met his match! It’s keeping him super entertained. Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Greatnfor large powerfull dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our pitbull loves playing with this large TuG. It is heavy and strong, so he can toss it around, tug-o-war games, and chew on it without it breaking apart so far. Been about 4 months and no tears yet (which is good, as KONG ones lasted about a day). This is for powerful dogs, or dogs over 50-60 pounds, as smaller dogs may feel this is too heavy for them!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: worthwhile toy!
customer_reviews.text: My friend has two big dogs- a pittie and a pit mix. They are heavy chewers and destroy most toys within minutes to days, with the exception of the Kong. They love this toy!! They each grab and end and tug or sometimes weplay tog with one of them. This toy has lasted about three months before we had to send it back. It has a lifetime guarantee which is worth it! It does have a strong rubbery tire odor which does go away. We liked this toy so much we've purchased some of Goughnuts other products. So far so good...the stick and ring are even tougher. Just be sure you purchase the toughest ones for heavy chewers.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: It's well made, but too big for to grab on to.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is as big around as a small bottle of pills. It's kind of awkward for both me and my 110lb dog. It does seems pretty indestructible and well made, it's just hard to play with. My dog destroys stuffed toys, but not toys made for pulling. If your dog destroys everything this is probably the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: David Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: 3 pit bulls approval!
customer_reviews.text: We have gotten everything from Kongs and the Maxx Gougnut rings and sticks. This has been the only thing that has lasted longer than any toy. We are on our second one in a year. We have had 3 Maxx Sticks and several Maxx rings and I lost count of all the Kong’s they’ve destroyed. With 3 dogs constantly playing tug of war and chewing on it when they are teething. It’s still staying strong. Best tough toy for extreme chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Lilo Konstanzer

customer_reviews.title: Best toy for true super chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a super chewer Golden Retriever. He chews almost all toys to pieces within minutes, even most “super chewer” toys. This is the only one we have purchased that he cannot destroy. We’ve had it for about a month and I cannot even see a scratch on it. I hesitated for awhile to buy this because of the price but it is going to pay for itself many times over.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Meh. My dog isn't impressed.
customer_reviews.text: We occasionally try to play with my 55 lb pit bull mix with it. Its a big for him because its really thick. It has a weird plastic/tire smell. It's faded a bit over time but he still isn't a fan. Maybe its too big for him or doesn't smell appealing. He loves to play tug & chew though.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE This Toy
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to recall all the toys my two dogs (a lab/husky mix and a hound mix) have gone through in a matter of days...but not this toy. We've had it for a few months now and it basically looks brand new. It did have a strong rubber smell for quite a while after receiving it but we use it outside with the dogs since it's also very hefty and you can barely smell the rubber now. I would not use this in the house because I could easily see it damaging something. Great for large, powerful chewers.
customer_reviews.author: M. T.

customer_reviews.title: No one could handle the smell
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviewers mentioned, it has a really strong smell. I ordered this almost 3 weeks before Christmas, let it air out (hidden from the dogs of course), and gave it to them on Christmas. Both of them sniffed it and walked away. I tried throwing it and they would chase after it, but one sniff and they ignored it. Had to send it back. :(
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bruce

customer_reviews.title: My dog would not touch it because of the smell
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy, but it's one of the only toys my dog wouldn't play with. He loves rubbery toys and his mission is to chew up and destroy toys, but he wouldn't touch this one because of the smell. I might need to smear it up with some peanut butter or coconut oil to eliminate the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Resperance

customer_reviews.title: Great for Power Chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is awesome! I have power chewers and they have chewed through Kong’s and the long tug toys etc. The toy is super thick and durable. They can sit and chew on it for hours and you can’t even tell. They play tug of war with each other too, doesn’t give much stretch though. It does have a very strong rubber smell, like a tire. Other than that, there are no complaints! I would definitely buy this again!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen S

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 GSDs have been playing with the Goughnuts TUG Interactive toy since it arrived. While it isn't as big a hit as a regular cotton rope, it is much safer and has out lasted 2 ropes - so well worth the money! We will be buying other Goughnuts toys as we love the red 'warning' layer with simplifies when to toss an older/destroyed toy.
customer_reviews.author: hear it live

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable (so far). My dogs destroy toys very quickly and this has held up to their gnawing. I have a large labrador and this is a bit big for her to get her mouth on solidly to play tug o war, but we manage. I was just afraid the size down would be a little too small and easier for her (and my bernese mtn dog) to destroy. Highly recommend this toy for people with dogs that love to play tug! There is no real "stretch" to this toy, but that is because its not supposed to be stretchy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Toy can take a chewing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my black lab and his little buddy that is a German Shepard/ rotty/ black lab mix. They chew on it and pull on it like crazy and can't seem to destroy it. I'm a big fan of the Gouhnuts products because of how tough they are. The one thing I notice is the dogs don't like the way they smell or taste when they first get them but once the toy has been run through the mud a few times they don't seem to mind it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and safe toy
customer_reviews.text: Underneath those three faces is the goughnuts toy! Two Border Collies and an Aussie week to destroy all things chewable! This toy has been really sturdy and I would recommend it! This is coming from someone who cancelled both bark box and bully box due to these monsters ruining the toys within seconds of being introduced! It’s expensive but I haven’t had to replace it, granted it’s only a week old but no damage yet (and that’s so rare)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Marie

customer_reviews.title: most durable dog toy ever, yet still very soft
customer_reviews.text: Best toy I'v ever gotten for my 75lb pitbull. its perfect for his size or larger, but the smaller pits have some trouble hanging on to it since it's pretty heavy and thick. he's chewed up every toy including the kong thing that looks like a turd in only a couple days. i've had this for months now and no damage at all!
customer_reviews.author: andy haney

customer_reviews.title: Happy beast!
customer_reviews.text: My beast is a vigorous constant chewer. He loves all of his goughnuts toys, AND still has them! The TuG is his favorite, he can hold it easily while chewing on it and loves playing tug-o-war. The TuG is his newest toy. I was afraid he would chew right through it because it’s thinner, but nope it’s just as strong as the others he has. I do have one question for the Goughnut company...can you make baseboards?
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Strong rubber smell
customer_reviews.text: The toy appears to be a durable, high quality product, which is great. However, it gives off a strong smell of rubber, and as such, my dog won't engage with it due to the rubber fumes. I washed it in the dishwasher, which helped a little bit. Maybe as time goes on, the fumes will dissipate.
customer_reviews.author: Jamestowne

customer_reviews.title: This power chewing dog owner is thoroughly impressed after 6 months, still in almost perfect shape
customer_reviews.text: I have a ~95lb Cane Corso/lab mix. Very strong dog. Toys never seem to last long with her, especially tug toys... except for this Goughnuts thing. We play with it all the time, and she loves chewing on it afterwards, and she’s never taken a single chunk out of it. There might be a few *light* surface scratches/blemishes on it from her teethmarks as we play, but there are practically no punctures. I am thoroughly pleased and would most certainly recommend this to owners of power chewing dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryna

customer_reviews.title: Worth it’s weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: My GSD has destroyed and obliterated every single chew toy and fetch toy we’ve ever bought for him, so I was skeptical and hesitant to spend almost $30 on this toy. But I am SUPER pleased! He hasn’t stopped gnawing on it since I gave it to him four days ago and there’s not even so much as a scratch or dent in it! He loves fetching it and playing tug of war, and of course incessantly gnawing on it. There is a slight “tire” smell, but it isn’t overwhelming or gross. I definitely recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Syders

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 if it wasn't so Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because our dog LOVES the gonoughts round one and we wanted another toy that he could play with and with our other dog as well. The toy is great except it is SUPER heavy for our dog to carry around (which is what he does 24/7). He is a German Wirehair so he is not a small dog either. For the two of them to play together it works fine but if just one of them has it it is too heavy. Our lab won't even pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Booker T

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: My pit and boxer love this! Only 4 days old and its in perfect shape. I leave it out and they chew on it for hours, not one tooth mark on it. Kings last hours with them. This brand is the only one I will ever buy! The rubber smell is the only draw back.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Great product for tug-of-war games
customer_reviews.text: We just received this toy and already our Dutch/Belgian Shepard has taken ownership. She's an agressive chewer so we'll see how well it holds up but after two days of moderate use it shows no signs of wear. It is much heavier than I expected. Having a loop for me to hold onto is a blessing. No more "accidental" nips or "tooth collisions" when she wants to play tug-of-war.
customer_reviews.author: Mudshark99

customer_reviews.title: SO WORTH IT YOU HAVE TO GET ONE!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY WORTH THE MONEY!!!!! My dog is an aggressive chewer and if he doesn't have a toy he finds anything around including my drywall and carpets... this toy has saved us so much money. It is a bit pricey but in the long run worth it! Only toy that has not been destroyed in less then two days. I have had this thing for months and he hasn't even made a dent in it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: T Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd destroys every chew type toy I get him, I don’t think he can destroy this one any time soon. My only issue was the smell wow it is really strong and after a week it’s still fairly strong. He likes to chew so it stays smell and all.
customer_reviews.author: shelley

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes, not entirely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I think us humans are more excited about giving them a toy lol I wouldn't say it's their favorite toy but they do enjoy it. It's looks like a great tug toy. The smell is certainly strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: One of the few toys not eaten
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is an aggressive chewer and this is one of the few toys he hasn't gotten through. Well worth the price if I add up all of the toys that only lasted 30 minutes. We’ve had it for months and it’s still in great shape. Dog seems disappointed he hasn’t destroyed it yet. He keeps trying though!
customer_reviews.author: M. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and practically indestructible.
customer_reviews.text: I have a male German Shepherd who is one of the most aggressive chewers I have ever met. He has finally after nearly a year into owning the toys, chewed slight cracks in the end of the toy. He wedges the toy in the rear of his jaw and just grinds on the end. Otherwise, there is only a few teeth marks on the rest of the toy. I highly recommend this toy as it is the only thing he has not totally destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott_H

customer_reviews.title: Pitbull Approved
customer_reviews.text: I own two Staffordshire Terriers, and they destroy every toy I give them, within minutes usually. This Goughnuts - TuG Interactive Large Dog Toy - MaXX Black actually withstands the rigors and abuse of two Pitbulls playing tug-of-war and random chewing. After 2 months, they have barely made a scratch on this toy and it is still in one piece. I am highly impressed with this product and recommend it to anyone with aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Krysta Butler

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy, so watch your toes if your dog drops it at your feet so you’ll play with him.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that he did not destroy it within the first hour. He’s had it for 8 days now and it’s still in great shape. He loves playing “Tug of War” with it. What I don’t like is the industrial/chemical smell that it has.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Goughnuts dog toy
customer_reviews.text: The product is very, very durable. you can definetely play alot of rough tug of war with your pup as long as you have one of these. However, it is pretty heavy. My pup wont touch it right now. I will have to wait until he gets to his full body maturity. Do not buy for a dog under 60-70 lbs. I don't see how any small dog would use this. If the dog takes to it, it will be worth the money. I can tell its not gonna be easy to rip or tear. Worth it, if the dog is big enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rush

customer_reviews.title: Sigh
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd who is rough with toys. She is a power chewer and loves to play tug. This is made extremely well but she rarely has interest in playing with it. My dog may not like it but yours might. Grade A quality toy.
customer_reviews.author: jojo104

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend, I would say I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: This is worth EVERY penny of the price. We have a young female shepherd about 80lbs with the jaws of death and destruction. She gnaws this thing hard and often, and not even a dent in it yet (about 4days). Everything else we have tried has been demolished within minutes. I highly recommend, I would say I'd buy it again, but don't think that will be for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: BillHilton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My baby's toys usually don't last more the 5 mins before there in to pieces on the floor. He has had this for about 3 to 4 months not and still going strong. I highly recommend this. He has a tier swing with bus tires he tears up in a week. So yeah definitely recommend this
customer_reviews.author: K'Tina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: We were having to buy a few toys a week until we found this! I have a medium size dog and bought the large toy. It’s a little big and heavy but my furry friend is undaunted. We’ve had our goughnuts for about a month and so far it’s stood up to chewing, throwing, and tug of war. I highly recommend this toy for the aggressive chewer in your life Update: When I first purchased this I had just gotten my dog. It’s been 5 months and she’s chewed through two steel chains. But, there isn’t even a tooth mark on this toy. She plays with it often and it has held up wonderfully. I’m buying the entire goughnuts line
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Great durability
customer_reviews.text: We have an American Staffordshire terrier who loves to tug and chew and this is the first toy she has had that has last for months without breaking apart. It looks just as new as the day we got it and strong. It does have a rubber smell initially but fades other than that it’s perfect and does as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pit Bulls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy over 4 years ago and it's still going strong. I leave it outside and my 2 pits play with it a few times a week. It has proven to be truly indestructible, which is rare for most dog toys. Great investment if you had a dog that's a hardcore chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hagood

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We've had this 6 months and it's still going strong with little to no signs of wear. The pup still loves it just as much and it's pretty much her go-to when she's ready to play. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra on a toy that will last you years.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality even better price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 80lb Pitt and he loves the rug of war aspect! And coming from a dog that has destroyed every "indestructible" toy ever, this thing was built to last. He's had it for 5 months. It's been pulled on, knawed on, and everything in between! And not a shred of damage or signs of wear. I will absolutely be depending this product.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Neither of my pit bulls will touch this smelly toy
customer_reviews.text: Dogs sniff and reject, presumably because of the smell - which I can easily smell, and it's not good. Many reviewers have mentioned this. My dogs are not picky.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Finger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the power chewer
customer_reviews.text: I love that my bull terrier hasn't destroyed this yet. She is chipping away at it in the middle. What's nice is that it is coming apart in tiny pieces that she can't choke on and wouldn't have a problem passing through her system if she swallows them. Finally I love that it has a replacement warranty
customer_reviews.author: Ericha H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Interactive Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the one we bought two years ago. Our boxer/pitbull mix is a maniac with this tug. Of course, somebody needs to be on the other end of it, so you get a workout too. We must be nuts, helping him build strength with this toy, but he does love it and it's a lot of fun for us too, especially if you are into scrambled brains!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for interactive play with your power chewer dog!  Worth the price indeed!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so if you have a dog who may be considered a power chewer, as my lab/pit mix is, this is the toy for you. He destroys most things in a few minutes (not his fault, as he is not aggressive, just a power chewer). Even those toys meant for power chewers are gone within 24-48 hours. This one, however, has lasted since Christmas...it is now almost March. No signs of wear and tear. He loves it, as it is a great interactive toy to use with his human friends and family members.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nana

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the goughnut
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the goughnut! this along with the red kong are the only toys that have survived my dalmation/weimaraner mix through her puppy years and 18 months later it's still going strong. It doesn't slowly fall apart like a lot of "indestructible" toys where she can swallow small bits and and there are no sharp edges. I also like that it's a tugging toy, great for exercise. My dog literally cannot have nice things including a bed because she tears EVERYTHING we give that she knows is hers so I'm grateful she has at least 2 toys and I highly recommend this for your doggy too!
customer_reviews.author: I Dream of Cookies

customer_reviews.title: Great for "chewy" dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! FINALLY something he hasn't destroyed!! Update Bought this in March of 2017, still looks new! We play hard with it but the difference is we have 2 power chewers.They play tug o war together. plus with humans. Would highly recommend the product line! We have the ball also and that still looks amazing. definitely worth the higher price once than a bunch of mid priced toys that they will destroy in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: TammyKAYT

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for large dogs...
customer_reviews.text: Our 150lb Rottweiler loves this thing, and this and several other Goughnut toys have outlived every other toy he's had. He can destroy a heavy duty tug rope inside a day, and despite a lot of chewing he's barely made a toothmark on this and two other toys from same vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Diesel LOVES this toy!
customer_reviews.text: Our Razors Edge pit bull, Diesel, is one of the smartest breeds we have ever owned. He is amazing, but very destructive with his toys. He loves to play tug of war and this toy is perfect! He carries it around the house and has yet to destroy it. Most toys, even his Kong, didn't last for more than a day! A bit expensive, but it comes with a warranty and seems to be well worth the money so far! We will definitely be going with Goughnuts products from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine C. Lordi

customer_reviews.title: My Baby Loves This Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my adorable Staffy girl. She got so excited when I took it out of the box! She loves to carry it around with her, diligently trying to entice her pack-mates to play tug with her. She also loves to chew on it, and so far, even though she can make quick work of nearly any chew toy, no visible tooth marks at all, and she's been working on it daily for a couple weeks now. Goughnuts are awesome chew toys, and stand up to the toughest chewers with rarely a whimper. Great toy for power chewers. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gloria G

customer_reviews.title: worth the expensive price tag for super strong/heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: Although this is one PRICEY toy, it is so worth the price! My american bulldog is a HUGE chewer and can go to town all day chewing toys. I normally buy Kong and I do love them (especially for the price...and I thought Kong was expensive lol), but these toys are clearly more durable and better for super strong chewers like my girl. I specifically bought it so that my bully and my moms young mix dog can play and THEY LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: 2 Pitbulls Approve!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY non-Kong toy I have found that my dogs can't destroy. We have had it for a week and my two pit bulls have dragged each other around with the toy daily using it in a constant tug o war. There aren't even teeth indents. Winner!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Review

customer_reviews.title: For truly large dogs.
customer_reviews.text: The first toy I've found that stands up to chewing abuse as well as Kong toys. It's a little heavy for my standard poodle, and he's larger than most, so it's not his favorite, but it's part of the group he chooses to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Big dog couldn't / didn't like gripping the fat rubber loop.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves tug-of-war more than any other game. She is a 90 pound malamute who can get her large mouth and BIG teeth around anything from a tennis ball can to large sticks. I tried to entice her with this TuG toy...she couldn't get a grip on it and gave up after several tries. She literally walked away to go stare out the window. A DuD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a tough toy? Found it!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a tug toy for our Am. Bulldog. He chews his bone, he plays with his ball, but he seemed a little bored with it all. This guy is a power chewer! We had to get something that was tough enough for him to gnaw on and tug on. This thing is great! Watson can't get enough of it!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Tippler

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up!
customer_reviews.text: My black lab is a power chewer and can normally destroy toys within a few days (or at least put a good "dent" in them). After about a month, this Goughnut is still surviving without a dent or scratch! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: If you need a sturdier tug toy, you better not leave your dog alone with car tires.
customer_reviews.text: This is the tug toy I've been looking for. My 86lb Lab/pitbull/husky/queensland Heeler mix who loves to play tug of war always chewed to pieces similar but thinner and smaller tug toys if left alone with them. Although I wouldn't trust her with this one for an extended amount of time its thick enough it would take her quite a while to break into it. Its comfortable in the hand and flexible enough to take the jarring tugs. And she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Specht

product_meta.title: Goughnuts - TuG Interactive Large Dog Toy - MaXX Black
feature_bullets: The GoughNuts Tug Toy was designed to address the simple but serious issue of SAFETY. The GoughNuts TuG was designed knowing that safety and fun go hand to mouth (a dog's jaw)!
The Goughnuts Tug Toy is an interactive tough, durable product
The GoughNuts TuG is for larger dogs. The Tug is 11 inches length, 6 inches in width, and has a 1.5 inch cross section

Our goals remain the same in that we want to provide the safest possible products that are durable and fun. The rubber is the same recipe as used on our rings but we have marked the outside with red to show that here is not a safety indicator in this product

In the case of the Tug Toy we are trying to protect the person as well as the dog. Please understand and consult a professional and or GoughNuts Team member if there are questions as to the function and safe play for you and your dog

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
